dev.galactic.star.database.impl

Class StarDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.galactic.star.database.impl.StarDatabase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MySqlDatabase

    public abstract class StarDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    The main Class used to interact with the different databases.
    Author:
    PrismoidNW

    • Method Detail

      • type

        public static StarDatabase type(DatabaseType dbType)
        The type of supported database at the moment. It takes an enum with several values.
        Parameters:
        dbType - Returns a new instance of the database corresponding with the type set. It inherits The StarDatabase class.
        Returns:
        StarDatabase

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks whether the connection is not null and is not closed.
        Returns:
        boolean(true / false) whether the connection is not null AND not closed already.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - The exception thrown by the isClosed method of the Java Connection class.

      • connect

        public abstract StarDatabase connect(java.lang.String username,
                                     java.lang.String password,
                                     java.lang.String host,
                                     java.lang.String tableName,
                                     int port,
                                     java.lang.String extraQueries)
        The abstract method that is called after calling the type method.
        Parameters:
        username - The username to the login of the database.
        password - The password to the login of the database. Recommended to have a strong, long password.
        host - The url, domain, or IP of the database itself.
        tableName - The name that will identify the table it is to change.
        port - The port that goes along with the host url when connecting.
        extraQueries - The extra queries one may want to add.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the class corresponding with the type you set in the beginning.

      • alterTable

        public abstract void alterTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                                StarDatabase.AlterTableType thingToChange,
                                java.lang.Object... objects)
        The abstract method that alters the tableName's name, tableName field, add or delete existing columns.
        Parameters:
        tableName - nameOfTheTable
        thingToChange - The updated version of the tableName you want to update. You must get the instance of the tableName and then change it to your desires.
        objects - List of arguments depending on the thing to change.

      • insert

        public abstract StarDatabase insert(java.lang.String tableName,
                                    java.lang.String[] columns,
                                    java.lang.Object[] objectsToInsert)
        The abstract method that inserts multiple pieces of data into a multiple columns.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of the table where the column belongs to.
        columns - The list of columns that data is going to be inserted into.
        objectsToInsert - The list of objects or data to be inserted.
        Returns:
        Instance of StarDatabase so that it can be chained.

      • getTableByName

        public Table getTableByName(java.lang.String tableName)
        Gets the table object by its name.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of the table.
        Returns:
        Table object.

      • createTables

        public abstract void createTables(Table... tables)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        The abstract method that is called after connecting to create a database.
        Parameters:
        tables - the list of tables to create.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if you don't have any tables to create.

      • createTables

        public abstract void createTables(java.lang.Class<?>... tables)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                  java.io.InvalidClassException
        The abstract method that is called after connecting to create a database.
        Parameters:
        tables - the list of classes, annotated by the DatabaseTable annotation.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if you don't have any tables to create.
        java.io.InvalidClassException

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
        Returns the connection of the database.
        Returns:
        Connection.

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug()
        This method allows to check the debug mode from the current Database.
        Returns:
        A boolean, which is true if debug mode is enabled and false if not.

      • setDebug

        public void setDebug(boolean debug)
        This method allows to set the debug mode to true or false.
        Parameters:
        debug - if true, error messages with their stacktrace, internal infos and warnings will be printed out completely. if false errors and warnings will be distinct to their core information.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Disconnects the connection if not already disconnected.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when either it is null or already closed.

      • getTables

        public java.util.Set<Table> getTables()
